head.supplied: Town Clerk's Office, ¶ Town Hall, ¶ Melbourne Jany 9th 1864 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I beg you to accepting apologies for only verbally answering your letter of the 16th ultimo, requesting the assent of the City Co...

div.p: M64/581, unit 9, p. 643, VPRS 4025/P Town Clerk's letter press copy books, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I beg you to accepting apologies for only verbally answering your letter of the 16th ultimo, requesting the assent of the City Council to the erection of a temporary fence across the Yarra Bank Road at the two end fences of the portion of Richmond Park, which was enclosed for zoological purposes, I was so hurried by business at the close of the year, that I really had not time to write to you indicating the assent of the City Council to your request which was given on the 21st ultimo and which I doubt not you have since acted upon.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
